ResortFeatures.resortFeatureSummary: Its stunning setting, luxurious accommodations, and many gracious amenities make this resort the perfect place for your Virgin Islands vacation. From its period architecture to pristine beach, every detail is bound to delight you at every turn.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: St. Thomas teems with natural adventures. You can snorkel at Coki Beach, charter a boat for fantastic fishing, sail to Caneel Bay on St. John or play in Morning Star Beach right outside your villa.

Resort.name: The Ritz-Carlton Club and Residences, San Francisco
Resort.intro:
A 19th century architectural gem is your personal urban oasis

Live without limits in one of the world's most romantic cities. Over a century ago, Chicago architects Daniel Burnham and John Root brought their vision of cloud-touching skyscrapers to San Francisco in the celebrated form of The Chronicle Building. Our extensive restoration brings back the splendor of that era, augmented with the casually elegant style of service and amenities that only The Ritz-Carlton can provide.
Resort.description: This urban oasis in the heart of the City by the Bay combines true elegance with legendary service in The Ritz-Carlton tradition — all surrounded by famous landmarks, shopping and fine dining.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Luxuriously-appointed 1-, 2- and 3-bedroom residences
  • Dedicated concierge

  • Spa and fitness center

ResortFeatures.resortFeatureSummary: At The Ritz-Carlton Club&reg and Residences, San Francisco, you will find yourself surrounded by everything the world loves about San Francisco just steps outside your door - the stylish shopping in Union Square, the bustling energy of The Financial District, the charming cable cars and fine dining galore.

ExternalCodes.uvCode: RF = San Francisco, FO = Whole Ownership

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: San Francisco is a unique, breathtaking city. The city takes pride in its unrivaled attractions, renowned museums, and unique neighborhoods. Discover the variety of sites, shops, and restaurants that reflect the city's great ethnic and cultural diversity.

Resort.name: Marriott's Royal Palms
Resort.intro:
An enchanting retreat

Tucked into an oasis of glorious palms, quiet lakes and placid pools, Marriott's Royal Palms offers a sublime vacation getaway. Stay and play like kings and queens in magical Orlando.
Resort.description: The perfect spot to enjoy everything from golf to world-famous theme parks as well as the amenities at the adjacent Orlando World Center Marriott<sup>®</sup> Resort & Convention Center.
Resort.importantNotice: Please note refurbishment efforts for the villas, roadways, and parking lots will begin October 7, 2017 through late November, 2017 and resume January 6, 2018 through March, 23, 2018. Guests may expect intermittent construction related activities/noise during this time. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Spacious, elegantly appointed 2-bedroom/2-bath villas accommodate up to 6 guests
  • In the heart of Orlando, minutes away from all the major theme parks
  • Two beautiful outdoor pools, whirlpool spas in a gorgeous setting amid lakes and palms
  • On-site restaurant, fitness center and recreation with outstanding golf, spas, dining and shopping nearby

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: All the world's favorite amusement theme parks are just minutes away, from Walt Disney World® Theme Parks to SeaWorld and Discovery Cove. Spectacular golf courses, spas and watersports are nearby, too. And speed fans can take a daytrip to Daytona-about an hour away.

Resort.intro:
Hit the Jackpot on Charm

Overlooking the amazing Las Vegas Strip, Marriott's Grand Chateau surrounds you in French provincial style. With its gracious accommodations, beautiful setting and many charms, this new resort makes your Vegas vacation a winner every time.
Resort.description: This posh resort with architecture and décor influenced by the elegance of southern France is just steps from all the excitement and luxury of the Entertainment Capital of the World.
Resort.importantNotice:
Please note that the 5th Floor Pool area will be closed for refurbishment on November 6, 2017 for 6 to 8 weeks. During this time, the 38th Floor Pool will remain open. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Please note that on November 7, 2017 from the hours of 12:00 a.m. to 6:00 a.m., the resort will be completing a critical maintenance project requiring all electricity and hot water in the building to be turned off. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Resort.name: The Ritz-Carlton Club, St. Thomas
Resort.intro:
Find inspiration in an enchanting tropical setting accompanied by understated luxury and graceful service

Nestled on 30 oceanfront acres alongside idyllic Great Bay, The Ritz-Carlton Club, St. Thomas is comprised of a small group of elegant plantation-style buildings situated along the powder white beach of Great Bay. It is a place to experience moments of dream-like island escape, perfected through the renowned service and amenities of The Ritz-Carlton.
Resort.description: Nestled on 30 oceanfront acres alongside idyllic Great Bay, this luxury resort offers a carefree Caribbean experience - complete with legendary service in The Ritz-Carlton tradition.
Resort.importantNotice: Please note that our main pool will be closed for renovations starting September 1, 2017 and will reopen on October 1, 2017. During the renovation period, our adult serenity pool and the Ritz-Carlton Hotel pool will be available to all Members and Guests. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and offer our sincere thanks for your patience and support.

ResortFeatures.resortFeatureSummary: Arriving at The Ritz-Carlton Club&reg, St. Thomas, is a homecoming in the most pleasurable sense of the word. No matter how long you've been away, you will find everything ready for your stay. A rich palette of unparalleled residential and vacation amenities is at hand, as is the gracious, five-star service that epitomizes The Ritz-Carlton.

When you are finished shopping, enjoy a quick meal and a drink in one of the district's many small restaurants and café

Resort.name: Marriott's Villas at Doral
Resort.intro:
Soak Up Miami

Located in one of the most posh and prestigious areas of Miami, Marriott’s Villas at Doral is a year-round vacation paradise. The golf, spas, beaches, dining and shopping here are all just like this lavish resort.
Resort.description: This tranquil hideaway is a mere 13 miles from the sizzling excitement of Miami Beach. You'll also enjoy privileged access to the celebrated Trump National Doral Miami.
Resort.importantNotice:
Various interior and exterior renovations are currently underway, with an expected completion date of November 30, 2016. Guests can expect some related activities/noise in the area. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. Should you need additional information, please contact the Front Desk at 305.629.3400.


Please note that construction activity will be occuring adjacent to the resort through 2020. Although adjacent construction activity and noise will occur, the existing amenities and facilities of Marriott’s Villas at Doral are not anticipated to be impacted. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

  • Spacious, elegantly appointed 2-bedroom/2-bath villas accommodate up to 8 guests
  • Located at Doral® Golf Resort & Spa, with access to 5 championship 18-hole courses and a world-class spa
  • In one of Miami's hottest districts, featuring exceptional dining, arts, shopping and nightlife
  • Outstanding on-site restaurants and lounges, store, fitness center and children's activities

ResortFeatures.resortFeatureSummary: Marriott’s Villas at Doral is an absolute dream for golf, spa and sun-seekers alike, making it one of the finest vacation spots in the world. Your resort home here is similarly sumptuous and unique, offering only the finest accommodations and services.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: Besides being surrounded by world-class golf courses and spas, Doral neighbors the dynamically hip South Beach with its beaches, shopping, dining and nightlife. Miami is also home to many great museums, cultural arts venues, fun parks and pro sports teams.

Resort.name: Marriott's St. Kitts Beach Club
Resort.intro:
Masterpiece

Next to the St. Kitts Marriott Resort on the sparkling shore of this Caribbean island jewel, Marriott's St. Kitts Beach Club, a Marriott Vacation Club℠ resort, offers a remarkable collection of amenities and stirring sights to ensure your vacations here are a sheer delight.
Resort.description: This relaxing retreat is just steps from the island's many charms. From pristine beaches to historic sites to emerald golf courses, there are lots of opportunities for recreation and inspiration.
Resort.importantNotice: Please note that this resort does not have elevators. The buildings are three stories high and the villas only accessible by stairs. If you have special needs, please contact the resort Pre-Arrival Planner at mvc.skbkt.prearrival@marriott.com

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Spacious and elegantly appointed 2- and 3-bedroom villas accommodate up to 10 guests
  • Spectacular oceanfront resort on the beach surrounded by many pools and lavish grounds
  • Adjacent to and with privileged access to St. Kitts Marriott Resort and The Royal Beach Casino
  • Exceptional golf course, spa and many restaurants and lounges
  • On-site fitness center, planned children's and family activities

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

No inquiry has been made into the activities or events, or the qualifications or the quality of services offered by the providers. Do not consider this an endorsement of or recommendation for any of the activities, events, or providers. Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.
ResortFeatures.resortFeatureSummary: From spectacular golf, spa, pools and casino gaming to its stunning beach setting, this retreat offers everything you could ask for in a Caribbean resort. Your getaway here will leave you yearning for a longer vacation.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: You can pamper yourself at the resort's spa, challenge yourself at the golf course's stunning seaside fairways and play at the casino right here. Nearby you can shop exotic St. Kitts, hike through rainforests, and enjoy great water activities from sailing to scuba.

Resort.name: Marriott's Maui Ocean Club
Resort.resortDisplayName: Marriott's Maui Ocean Club - Molokai, Maui & Lanai Towers
Resort.intro:
Paradise Found

Amid the azure Pacific, along the crystal sands of Kaanapali Beach, Marriott’s Maui Ocean Club is an island jewel among lush rainforests and volcanic mountain offering an oasis of relaxation, adventure and bliss.
Resort.description: Located on Kaanapali Beach, this resort is surrounded by beautiful scenery and some of the most picturesque conditions for golf, tennis, diving and mountain biking you'll find anywhere.
Resort.importantNotice:
Beginning August 18, 2018 through November 17, 2018, Marriott's Maui Ocean Club, Lahaina & Napili Towers will be renovating our villas. Refurbishment activity will occur daily from 8:00 am - 5:00pm. During these hours guests may experience typical construction noise such as operating machinery, moving containers and carpentry work. All existing resort amenities will remain open and fully-operational for guest use and enjoyment. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Please note that the Maui Ocean Club I Suites are equipped with a kitchenette which does NOT include a stove/oven or cooktop. A communal kitchen is available in the Molokai Tower at the lobby level (across from the Front Desk) for you use. BBQs are also available. For additional details please email mvchnmmh.prearrival@vacationclub.com or call the property at 808-667-1200.

The Molokai, Maui and Lanai suites have Wet Bar facilities only, which include a microwave, a small refrigerator, dishwasher, coffee maker, toaster, blender, and tableware. The suites do not have washer and dryers in the units, but we do have a large complimentary laundry room for our guests use.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Splendid 1-bedroom/2-bath and 2-bedroom/3-bath suites accommodate up to 8 guests
  • Oceanfront suites on Kaanapali Beach, all with garden/mountain or ocean views
  • Excellent golf at the Kaanapali Golf Courses North and South and other nearby courses
  • Meandering outdoor pools with waterfall, walking bridges, pool bar
  • Several on-site restaurants, fitness center and planned children/family activities

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: There are so many exotic ways to experience this Pacific paradise - hike volcanoes, snorkel pristine reefs, trek the island countryside on ATVs, sail into the sunset, explore island culture, hit the links or relax with a beachside message the choice is yours.

MapAndTransportation.title: Maps and Transportation
MapAndTransportation.drivingDirectionIntroText: From Regional Airports to local businesses to historic attractions, our interactive map will help you get there with ease.

Resort.name: Marriott's Desert Springs Villas II
Resort.intro:
Palm Desert Paradise

Set amongst lush green grounds, waterfalls and palms, Marriott's Desert Springs Villas II sparkles against the Palm Desert. Here, wonderful vacations filled with memorable activities and majestic sights are anything but a mirage.
Resort.description: This stylish retreat is shaded by the San Jacinto Peak and surrounded by natural desert beauty. Plus you'll enjoy many perks at the nearby JW Marriott<sup>®</sup> Desert Springs Resort & Spa.
Resort.importantNotice:
Our resort is undergoing various phases of construction throughout the year, including villa and street refurbishments. Guests may expect intermittent noise due to the use of construction machinery for all projects. We thank you for understanding and apologize for any inconvenience.

Marriott's Desert Springs Villas is currently undergoing villa renovations that will last through October, 2018. Some noise may be heard during the hours of 8 a.m. - 6:30 p.m.

Please note that there are two popular music festivals that occur during the month of April. The Coachella Music Festival dates are April 13th – 15th and April 20th– 22nd in 2018. The dates for the Stagecoach Music Festival in 2018 are April 27th – 29th. Guests can expect above average traffic in and around the area during the aforementioned dates.

Reminder, use of amenities at the JW Desert Springs Marriott Resort and Spa are subject to seasonal availability and/or blackout dates. Fees may apply, inquire at check-in.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Spacious and elegant 2-bedroom/2-bath villas comfortably accommodate up to 8 guests
  • 7 outdoor pools, whirlpools, surrounding lake with scenic waterfalls
  • Excellent golf options at the JW Marriott Desert Springs Resort & Spa and other local courses
  • On-site restaurants, The Marketplacesm store, fitness center and planned kids activities

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: Palm Desert is brimming with exotic sights to see and fun things to do. Explore the Living Desert or trek through Joshua Tree National Park. Mosey through museums, try your luck at a casino or enjoy the spectacular golf and swim facilities right here.

MapAndTransportation.title: Maps and Transportation
MapAndTransportation.drivingDirectionIntroText: From Regional Airports to local businesses to historic attractions, our interactive map will help you get there with ease.

Resort.name: Marriott's Aruba Ocean Club
Resort.intro:
Astounding Aruba

Perfectly placed on famed Palm Beach, with sweeping views across crystal-clear Caribbean waters, Marriott's Aruba Ocean Club, a Marriott Vacation Club® resort, captures the island's rare beauty and tranquility. Come sink your toes in the sand at this spectacular island resort.
Resort.description: From this beachside resort, enjoy world-class diving, duty-free shopping and nightlife. You'll also have access to the amenities at Aruba Marriott<sup>®</sup> Resort & Stellaris<sup>®</sup> Casino and the Mandara Spa.
Resort.importantNotice: Please note the pool facilities and rock structures will be closed beginning September 2018 for approximately 4 weeks to undergo resurfacing and maintenance. During that time, there will be alternate swimming facilities available. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Spacious and elegantly appointed studio, 1- and 2-bedroom villas accommodate up to 8 guests
  • Spectacular oceanfront resort on a powder white sand beach
  • Beautiful setting with winding pools, waterfall and whirlpool spas, walkways and bridges
  • On-site restaurants, fitness center, tennis and basketball courts, planned children's activities

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

No inquiry has been made into the activities or events, or the qualifications or the quality of services offered by the providers. Do not consider this an endorsement of or recommendation for any of the activities, events, or providers. Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.
ResortFeatures.resortFeatureSummary: Staying on the magical island of Aruba is an even more amazing experience thanks to the remarkable accommodations, services and amenities offered at this resort. Feast all of your senses at a place that prides itself on satisfying your every wish.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: Azure waters offer awesome snorkeling and scuba, wonderful wind-surfing, beach combing and much more. You can also explore the inland by jeep, play at fabulous golf courses and casinos, catch a Kukoo Kunuku Party Bus or Tattoo Party Cruise.

Resort.name: Marriott's Newport Coast Villas
Resort.intro:
Newport Beach Opulence

Perched high on a bluff above the majestic Pacific, Marriott's Newport Coast Villas captures the style and grace of Newport Beach. From its beautiful architecture to abundant activities, this is a most distinctive California vacation place.
Resort.description: This 75-acre, Tuscan-inspired enclave is perched atop a bluff offering sweeping views of the Pacific Ocean and Catalina Island – the perfect vantage point for exploring this alluring destination.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Elegantly appointed and spacious villas accommodate up to 8 guests
  • Fitness center, two outdoor heated pools, whirlpool, plus separate children's pool
  • Sauna, sports court, putting green, and children's activity areas
  • Numerous options nearby for water sports, golf, shopping, dining and entertainment

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: Southern California is renowned for good times and big adventures. Visit its world-famous fun parks, shop its glittering boulevards, take in the best of the arts around Orange County, venture to Catalina Island or drop in south of the border on Tijuana.

Resort.name: Marriott's SurfWatch
Resort.intro:
An Irresistible Getaway

Located along a beautiful stretch of shoreline on popular Hilton Head Island, Marriott's SurfWatch is sure to impress. It's hard to resist this charming resort's seaside setting, spacious accommodations and fine amenities
Resort.description: With its private oceanfront location, this resort offers scenic views of the Atlantic and rolling sand dunes. Enhance your experience with nearby golf, tennis and miles of trails for hiking and biking.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Spacious and elegantly appointed 2- and 3-bedroom villas accommodate up to 8 guests
  • Beautiful oceanfront location with excellent views and privacy
  • Meticulously landscaped and lavishly equipped grounds featuring oceanfront pools, private cabanas, many firepits, grills and picnic areas
  • Located near many world-class golf courses, spas and restaurants
  • On-site fitness center

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: You're surrounded by Low-Country excursions and endless indoor/outdoor possibilities while on Hilton Head Island. Ride bikes through Harbour Town. Climb to the top of a lighthouse. Discover Pinckney Island National Wildlife Refuge. Stroll through Savannah. Or play dozens of magnificent golf courses.

Resort.name: Marriott's Village d'Ile-de-France
Resort.intro:
Beaucoup Charm and Style

Rising like a royal palace and gardens from the French countryside — mere miles from glittering Paris and Disneyland® Resort Paris — Marriott's Village d'Ile-de-France, a Marriott Vacation Club resort, invites guests to experience vacations of rare charm and savoir faire.
Resort.description: This resort offers the ideal balance between the calming French countryside and the allure of Paris. Explore picturesque landscapes that inspired Monet or take a short train ride to the City of Light.
Resort.importantNotice:
Identification of all occupying guests will be required upon check-in.

Please note there is ongoing construction on the land adjacent to the resort. For more information, please contact the resort. We thank you for your understanding and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

ResortData.resortAtAGlance:
Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Spacious and elegantly appointed 2- and 3-bedroom townhouses accommodate up to 8 people
  • Remarkable 2-story townhouse-style villas with private terraces
  • Located in the French countryside, just miles outside of Paris
  • Beautifully landscaped grounds with expansive pools, gardens and lake
  • The Marketplacesm convenience store, fitness center, planned children's/family activities

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: All the excitement of Paris is just miles away, from shopping on the Champs-Éleses to touring amazing art museums, monuments and cathedrals. Also explore nearby Versailles, sample the fruits of French wineries, and feast on world-famous cuisine.

Marriott Vacation Club Pulse, New York City puts you at the center of the action in one of the world’s most vibrant cities. Owners will have access to this historic property through the Marriott Vacation Club DestinationsTM Exchange Program.

  • Relax in your beautifully appointed room or — better yet — in one of New York City’s most spectacular rooftop bars, your very own urban oasis
  • Within walking distance of flagship retail stores, beautiful Bryant Park, and the bustle of Times Square
  • Take in an iconic Broadway show. Explore the renowned Garment District — the global epicenter of fashion and design — or immerse yourself in art, history and culture by experiencing New York City’s internationally acclaimed museums and exhibits.

Resort-At-a-Glance

  • Elegantly appointed and spacious 2-bedroom/2-bath villas accommodate up to 8 guests
  • Spectacular beachfront resort with lush grounds and 3 large outdoor pools
  • Located near many of the world's most acclaimed and scenic golf courses
  • Restaurant, The Marketplacesm convenience store, fitness center and children/family activities

Features, furnishings and amenities may be proposed and are subject to change.

  • This welcoming island resort will feature three swimming pools, two local championship golf courses, an ancient Hawaiian fish pond and petroglyphs as old as time — all adjacent to the white sands of Anaehoomalu Bay.
  • Beyond the resort you can explore jungle trails on foot or horseback, or trek along ancient lava tubes. Stroll black sand beaches and wander through colorful towns. Or set your sights even higher and tour active volcanoes of the snowcapped summit of Mauna Kea.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: Palm Beach County is an invigorating crossroad of outdoor adventures and cosmopolitan fun. You can enjoy virtually every imaginable watersport here, from wave running to deep-sea fishing. Or hit the town for world-class dining, shopping, shows and more.

San Francisco is a unique, breathtaking city. The city takes pride in its unrivaled attractions, renowned museums, and unique neighborhoods. Discover the variety of sites, shops, and restaurants that reflect the city's great ethnic and cultural diversity.
St. Thomas teems with natural adventures. You can snorkel at Coki Beach, charter a boat for fantastic fishing, sail to Caneel Bay on St. John or play in Morning Star Beach right outside your villa.

This area provides plenty of natural wonders to see and remarkable things to do. Explore the desert on horseback; take a gallery stroll in Scottsdale, go rock climbing, or stick to golf at the Wildfire Golf Club or a relaxing massage at nearby Revive Spa.

Palm Desert is brimming with exotic sights to see and fun things to do. Explore the Living Desert or trek through Joshua Tree National Park. Mosey through museums, try your luck at a casino or enjoy the spectacular golf and swim facilities right here.

Exciting excursions and good times abound on this enchanted isle. Hit the beach for amazing swimming, surfing, snorkeling and sun. Visit the Pearl Harbor Memorials. Explore the island's beautiful interior by foot, horseback or helicopter. Golf on challenging courses. It's all up to you.

Besides being surrounded by world-class golf courses and spas, Doral neighbors the dynamically hip South Beach with its beaches, shopping, dining and nightlife. Miami is also home to many great museums, cultural arts venues, fun parks and pro sports teams.

Las Vegas isn't America's #1 tourist destination for nothing. Experience world-class entertainment at dozens of larger-than-life casinos. Relax at stunning spas or golf at challenging links. Explore Red Rock Valley. Tour towering Hoover Dam. Or recreate on beautiful Lake Meade.

All the world's favorite amusement theme parks are just minutes away, from Walt Disney World® Theme Parks to SeaWorld and Discovery Cove. Spectacular golf courses, spas and watersports are nearby, too. And speed fans can take a daytrip to Daytona-about an hour away.

The stars come out every night at Branson's dozens of music stages and playhouses. Visit nearby White Water Park, sip libations at Stone Hill Winery, cruise Table Rock Lake on the Showboat Branson Belle or step back in time at Silver Dollar City.

The experiences awaiting here are countless. You can ride a donkey through ancient Miha Village, tour nearby Ronda by horse carriage, take a day trip to exotic Tangiers, golf magnificent courses, sip wine and sample tapas by the sea, just to name a few.

Lake Tahoe offers magnificent year-round skiing, snowboarding and more. Year round you and your family can enjoy exploring the area's beauty by boat or trail to basking in hot springs to enjoying the many cultural arts and historic attractions.
The resort's prime location sets it amidst world-class shopping and dining, watersports, and magnificent golf courses.

Tour the myriad historical sites of Boston on foot, by trolley or Duck Boat, an amphibious land/water rover. Enjoy world-famous dining, shopping and performing arts. Cruise to Boston Islands State Park, go whale watching and much, much more.

There are so many exotic ways to experience this Pacific paradise - hike volcanoes, snorkel pristine reefs, trek the island countryside on ATVs, sail into the sunset, explore island culture, hit the links or relax with a beachside message the choice is yours.

Bangkok is a unique blend of Thailand’s past and present. During the day, tour the city and marvel at historic monuments and modern architectural wonders. At night, experience the excitement of the city’s clubs and cafés. You’ll also find plenty of shopping opportunities, including the area’s largest market and urban shopping malls offering virtually anything you can imagine.

Marriott’s Bali Nusa Dua Gardens will be the ideal home base for discovering the diverse charms of Bali, from the fresh seafood of Jimbaran to the colorful reefs of Padang Bai, and from the fashionable boutiques of Seminyak to the spiritual sites of Ubud. Embrace adventure and immerse yourself in the vibrant, friendly culture as you explore vivid landscapes ranging from dramatic volcanoes to picturesque rice paddies.

When you're not on one of the island's many PGA-sanctioned courses, bask in the sun, swim, collect shells or go crabbing on the beach. Horseback ride at Sea Pines Plantation. Visit nearby Savannah. Play on our five Har-Tru clay tennis courts and much more.

St. Thomas is famous for its shopping opportunities, especially along Charlotte Amalie, the main shopping district. Stores and boutiques in beautiful historic buildings line the roads, from the high streets to the side streets and alleys. When you are finished shopping, enjoy a quick meal and a drink in one of the district's many small restaurants and café

From Walt Disney World<sup>®</sup> Theme Parks to SeaWorld, Orlando is home to the world's biggest and best theme parks. Great golf, spas and water sports are also nearby. And don't miss the fun-filled festivals, from Mardi Gras at Universal Studios to Mickey's Very Merry Christmas.

Spain's “sun coast" shines with attractions and adventures. Visit old Seville and tour its gigantic cathedral, play spectacular golf courses, sample the glittering nightlife of Puerto Ban's, take a daytrip to Tangiers, or learn to flamenco and relax right here.

Enjoy incredible outdoor recreation from skiing Park City's renowned ski areas to river rafting or plunging down a 3,000-foot alpine slide. The golf is great here, too. And don't miss world-class shopping, dining and the Sundance Film Festival.

From Walt Disney World® Theme Parks to SeaWorld, Orlando is home to the world's biggest and best theme parks. Great golf, spas and water sports are also nearby. And don't miss the fun-filled festivals, from Mardi Gras at Universal Studios to Mickey's Very Merry Christmas.

A world of culinary delights, sun-soaked streets, ocean beaches, and vibrant nightlife awaits you. From the restaurants and galleries of Lincoln Road to the boutique shops and nightclubs of Collins and Washington Avenues—and the turquoise waters of Miami Beach right across the street.

Australia's Gold Coast offers an abundance of natural scenic beauty and outdoor activities amid sun, sand and surf. Vacationers can also explore family friendly attractions, city adventures and wildlife sanctuaries — and Marriott Vacation Club at Surfers Paradise is the perfect starting point to experience it all.

During your stay at Marriott’s Waikoloa Ocean Club, you will be able to explore jungle trails on foot or horseback, trek ancient lava tubes, stroll black sand beaches and wander through colorful towns. Or you can set your sights even higher and tour active volcanoes or the snowcapped summit of Mauna Kea.

All the excitement of Paris is just miles away, from shopping on the Champs-Éleses to touring amazing art museums, monuments and cathedrals. Also explore nearby Versailles, sample the fruits of French wineries, and feast on world-famous cuisine.

When you're not on the island's many challenging golf courses, delve into South Carolina Low-Country excursions-from kayak tours to leisurely horseback rides, from day trips to Savannah to summer fireworks at Shelter Cove.

Experience Kauai on foot, horseback, kayak, ATV, helicopter or from your private lanai. Play the world-famous courses, lounge on the exotic beaches. Embrace authentic Polynesian culture and witness island sunsets like nowhere else on earth.

Orlando provides so many great things to do on your vacation-from its awesome theme parks and shows to world-class golf and spa facilities to fine dining and cultural exhibits. Soak it all up or escape from it all at Marriott's Grande Vista.

While magnificent skiing tops the list of attractions here, there's lots of other great things to see and do here - from sensational golf courses to fly-fishing to river rafting, quaint Park City shopping, thumping nightlife and nature excursions galore.

Florida's famed west coast provides endless exciting excursions- from beach days to amazing golf and spa experiences, touring Marco Island by trolley or even adventuring into the Everglades National Park by airboat.

Skiing at some of the world's finest ski areas tops the list of favorite activities here - but close behind are many other fun diversions, from ice skating to summer hiking to spa treatments and casino hopping..all in the heart of picturesque Breckenridge.

Vail is bursting with awesome slopes, elegant designer shops, exquisite art galleries, happening nightlife and cultural events. And the majestic outdoors brim with action all year long, from hiking and biking to climbing to angling and watersports.

Hilton Head Island offers countless Low-Country excursions, sweeping sights and outdoor recreation. Ride a bike to the beach at Palmetto Dunes. Climb to the top of a lighthouse. Discover Pinckney Island National Wildlife Refuge. Stroll through Savannah. Or play dozens of challenging golf courses.

Few places in the world pack so many attractions into such a beautiful spot. Golf at more than 100 amazing courses. Wander the Grand Strand coast with 60 miles of beaches. See spectacular shows, hear exceptional live music - the list goes on and on.

Aspen is a recreational, social and cultural mecca for people from all around the globe. It's celebrated for many things including world-class skiing and snowboarding, acclaimed cuisine and one-of-a-kind shopping.

You're surrounded by Low-Country excursions and endless indoor/outdoor possibilities while on Hilton Head Island. Ride bikes through Harbour Town. Climb to the top of a lighthouse. Discover Pinckney Island National Wildlife Refuge. Stroll through Savannah. Or play dozens of magnificent golf courses.

From your comfortable home base, explore the historic sites, cultural offerings and world-class shopping and dining of the nation's capital. All the city's famous attractions await your discovery, from the White House to the Smithsonian and the National Mall.

Southern California is renowned for good times and big adventures. Visit its world-famous fun parks, shop its glittering boulevards, take in the best of the arts around Orange County, venture to Catalina Island or drop in south of the border on Tijuana.

There's so much to experience and explore on Florida's magnificent Gulf Coast, from sunning yourself on sugar-white sands at nearby Panama City Beach to golf and soothing views of St. Andrews Bay. For those wanting a little more adventure, a variety of fishing and watersports await you in beautiful Panama City.

Azure waters offer awesome snorkeling and scuba, wonderful wind-surfing, beach combing and much more. You can also explore the inland by jeep, play at fabulous golf courses and casinos, catch a Kukoo Kunuku Party Bus or Tattoo Party Cruise.

Your stylish downtown San Diego retreat offers an ideal central location for exploring all that San Diego has to offer, from the bustling Gaslamp Quarter with its colorful array of award-winning restaurants, rooftop bars, happening nightclubs, art galleries and boutiques, to Balboa Park, home to many of San Diego’s museums and cultural venues as well as the legendary San Diego Zoo. With the world-class attractions, arts, culture, cuisine, and nightlife at your doorstep, you will never run out of things to do and discover while visiting one of California’s most celebrated coastal cities.

You can explore the island by jeep, enjoy its warm clear waters for spectacular scuba and snorkeling, ride the wind on a parasail or windsurf adventure, golf at wonderful courses, try your luck at a nearby casino or dine and dance on a Tattoo Party Cruise.

There's so much to experience and explore in Fort Lauderdale, from sunning yourself at the beach to practicing your putt at top golf courses to indulging at famous spas. This exciting city offers deep-sea fishing, gallery hopping and everything in between.

All the world's best theme parks are just a few short minutes away - from Walt Disney World<sup>®</sup> Theme Parks to SeaWorld<sup>®</sup> to Universal Studios<sup>®</sup>. You can also find spectacular golf courses, sensational spas and countless other recreational activities right around the corner.

As if playing Nick Faldo's Championship Course wasn't enough, there are lots of other great excursions and diversions nearby. From soaring up the Palm Springs Tramway to glorious hiking and superb shopping, there's never a dull moment here.

Exotic Thai adventures await. Discover incredible adventures, from trekking through jungles on elephants to nature cruises via sea canoes. Exotic shopping, spectacular golf and delicious dining also abound.

Grande Lakes Orlando offers an array of fine restaurants, superb golf, exciting eco tours and an indulgent spa. And for those who like to explore, the energetic city of Orlando has plenty to offer as well. From a dazzling array of world-renowned attractions to fabulous shopping, dining and nightlife experiences. Enjoy the energy and excitement of the city or retreat from action-packed days at Marriott's Lakeshore Reserve.

When you're not playing the island's challenging golf courses, explore various Low-Country activities - from kayak tours to glorious horseback rides, from day trips to Savannah to summer fireworks shows at Shelter Cove.
Vail is a quintessential mountain resort town, with unparalleled skiing and equally impressive summertime recreation.

Explore this exciting island on bike or horseback, comb miles of beautiful beaches, climb to the top of a lighthouse or kayak shimmering waterways. Sun and swim at the beach or the resort's pools. Or golf at as many of the island's incredible courses as you can.

The Palm Springs area is bursting with adventures and activities - from spectacular rounds of golf on fabled courses to sumptuous days at world-class spas, from excursions to nearby casinos and theme parks to trekking through national parks.
Discover incredible adventures, from trekking through jungles on elephants to nature cruises via sea canoes. Exotic shopping, spectacular golf and delicious dining also abound.

You can pamper yourself at the resort's spa, challenge yourself at the golf course's stunning seaside fairways and play at the casino right here. Nearby you can shop exotic St. Kitts, hike through rainforests, and enjoy great water activities from sailing to scuba.

Explore the garden isle on foot, horseback, kayak or ATV to discover its stunning beauty and views. Cruise the Wailua River and experience Polynesian culture, or golf at some of the world's finest courses and sun on its most famed and filmed beaches.

LocalActivities.localActivitiesDetails: Note: New York wCities will be added soon
LocalActivities.localActivitiesIntro: Within walking distance of flagship retail stores, beautiful Bryant Park, and the bustle of Times Square, Marriott Vacation Club<sup>®</sup>, New York City makes it easy to feel the thrill of mingling with locals and tourists alike at the Crossroads of the World. Take in an iconic Broadway show. Explore the renowned Garment District or immerse yourself in art, history, and culture by experiencing New York City’s internationally acclaimed museums and exhibits.
Lake Tahoe offers magnificent skiing, snowboarding and more. Enjoy exploring the area's beauty by boat or trail and the many cultural arts and historic attractions.

An abundance of remarkable recreations and adventures beckon. Hike the Serra de Tramuntana trails, explore the underground lakes of Drach Caves, ride horseback to the shore, explore Bellver Castle, and enjoy sensational golf, beaches and so much more.

Golf, of course, tops the list of things to do here, with more than 20 PGA-sanctioned courses on the island. Spend a romantic day in nearby Savannah. Build your seashell collection. Ride horseback on the beach. Or sail into the sunset.

Cross the bay to play and see shows at the famed Atlantic City Boardwalk and casinos, or comb the 127-mile coastline to find your perfect beach. Also see famous lighthouses, visit historic towns, or enjoy the world-class golf and spa right here.

When you're not playing the island's many fabulous golf courses, consider Low-Country diversions from kayaking to horseback riding, day trips to Savannah or Adventure Cove, or seeing the fireworks at Shelter Cove.

So Much To Do. Grand Residence Club, Lake Tahoe is in the center of all the South Shore of Lake Tahoe has to offer. Summer, winter, spring, or fall, Lake Tahoe teems with activity. It is a place where you can catch a fish most days of the year, and the Sierra Nevada provides opportunities for hiking, biking, horseback riding, and rock climbing amongst other activities.

Spots for great family fun abound here. Visit Busch Gardens Williamsburg or Water Country USA theme parks. Step back in time at Jamestown Settlement or nearby Yorktown. Enjoy great golf at Ford's Colony or day trips to many other amazing sites.

No trip to Orlando is complete without visiting the world's favorite theme parks - including Walt Disney World® Theme Parks and Universal Studios. But many other options abound from golfing to spa excursions to local dining and shopping attractions.

Discover Unforgettable Natural Beauty. Kauai is an alluring paradise teeming with thrilling adventure and rich culture -from laid-back leisure to exhilarating activity; from romantic catamaran cruises to exciting authentic luaus; from the tranquil, sun-soaked sands of Na Pali Coast to the rugged, scenic trails of Waimea Canyon. Spend your days exploring the island's endless natural beauty by land or by water. Sail, kayak, surf or snorkel, or embark on a whale-watching cruise. Explore a wildlife refuge and botanical garden. Admire breathtaking views while you challenge your skill at a scenic championship golf course. Or simply relax on the soft sands of one of Kauai's coveted beaches. Whatever your vacation bliss, you'll find it here.

Airports.drivingDirection: Take the Rama 9 Expressway and turn left onto Din Daeng/Dao Kanong Route. Continue to Rama III (Chongnonsee — Nanglinchee) and merge onto Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra Road. Continue to Soi 6. Marriott Vacation Club at The Empire Place<sup>©</sup> is on the left between Soi 6 and 4.
Depart Eastern Ave. At the roundabout, take the 2nd exit onto Terminal Dr. Bear left onto 2 / Gold Coast Hwy. Arrive at 2 / Ferny Ave / Gold Coast Hwy on the left.

Follow signs to North exit. Take 528 W (toll road) to exit #1 (Int'l Dr/Sea World exit). Turn left on Int'l Dr. At traffic light, make a right on Westwood Blvd. Marriott's Harbour Lake is located approx 1 1/2 miles on right.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Hema Transportation; reservation required
  • Estimated taxi fare: $55 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Follow signs to 1-595 West. merge onto 1-595 West and go approx. 13 miles. Merge onto 1-75 (Portions toll). Travel 84 miles to Exit 101 (CR 951 S/Collier Blvd). Merge onto CR-951 S towards Marco Island. Resort will be approx. 18 miles on the right.

Merge onto FL-836 W (Portions toll). Take the NW 107th Ave exit towards Florida's Turnpike South toward Homestead/Key West. After approx 2 miles, merge onto Tamiami Trl E/US-41 W/FL-90 W. Travel 80 miles then turn left onto CR-92. Go 11.5 miles and turn left onto S Collier Blvd/FL-951 S. The resort will be approx 1 mile on the right.

Exit E. Airport Drive to S. Archibald Ave. to I-10 East. Take I-10 for 78 miles to Cook St. exit. Exit Cook Street go right and proceed 2 1/2 miles to the Villas entrance. The entrance is on Cook Street, on the right side of the street 1/2 mile past Country Club Drive. Turn right on Riviera Drive.

Airports.airportName: From John F Kennedy International Airport – JFK
Airports.drivingDirection: Exit airport on JFK Expressway N. Take exit onto I-678 N/Van Wyck Expressway N. Take exit 12B for Long Island Expressway/I-495W. Take exit toward 3rd Ave/41. Merge onto E 37th St and the hotel will be on the right.

Take the North Exit from Orlando Int'l Airport. Follow the signs for 528 West (or Beeline Expressway). On 528 W., proceed through two toll booths and a total of approximately 10 miles. Take Exit #1 (Int'l Dr/Sea World). Turn left on Int'l Dr. and proceed 1.5 miles to Grande Vista which is located on the Left.

From I-95 North: Take exit 8 in South Carolina (Highway 278). Go East on Hwy 278 for approx. 20 miles. Go over two consecutive bridges that span the Inter Coastal waterway onto Hilton Head Island. As you reach the division of Hwy 278, stay in the right lane, following the signs for Hwy 278 business (William Hilton Parkway). Proceed to Shelter Cove Harbour approximately 8 miles onto the Island. Drive past the plaza and the mall at Shelter Cove. At the traffic light, turn right, then take second quick left onto Shelter Cove Lane and continue 6/10 of a mile. The resort entrance is on the left.

Follow signs exiting airport to I-95 North. From I-95, I-95 take exit 8, continue on highway 278 (approx. 40 mins). Once over the HHI bridge, go approx. 4 miles to the Cross Island Expressway ($1.25 toll road). Follow expressway onto Palmetto Bay Road. Enter Sea Pines traffic circle from the left lane & follow circle to Pope Avenue (2nd right). Take Pope Avenue to Coligny Circle. Exit onto so forest beach Drive (1st right). Drive 3/4 mi. Hotel on left.

Take State Road 836 (Dolphin Expressway) W. Drive approx. 5 miles to NW 87th Ave N. Exit. Once exited, make a left turn at first traffic light - NW 12th St. At next traffic light make right on NW 87th Ave (Galloway Road), drive approx 2 miles, the resort will be on the right hand side.

Travel on James L Turnage Blvd following signs for I-95. Keep right at the fork, follow signs for I-95 S/Miami and merge onto I-95 S Keep left to stay on I-95 S. Travel 69.1 miles. Keep right at the fork to stay on I-95 S, follow signs for US 441/Florida 9/Florida 826/Forida Turnpike, .9 miles then keep left to stay on I-95 S, follow signs for Miami, 1.6 miles. Merge onto I-95 S, .9 miles then use the left 2 lanes to take exit 2D toward I395 E/Miami Beach, .9 miles. Merge onto MacArthur Causeway. Travel 1.4 miles and continue onto Florida A1A N/State A1A N. Travel 3.7 miles then exit LEFT on Collins Avenue. Continue on Collins Avenue for 0.8 mile then turn right onto 14th St. Turn left onto Ocean Dr. and the resort will be on the left.

From I-64 West take Lightfoot Exit 234A (Rte. 199). Proceed on Rte. 199 East approximately 4.5 miles to Longhill Rd. Exit (Rte. 612). Stay in right exit lane and turn right at stoplight onto Longhill Rd. Proceed on Longhill Rd. for 2.4 miles to entrance to Ford's Colony on left. Turn left onto Ford's Colony Dr. and go 1.1 miles. Follow traffic circle to St. Andrews Dr that veers to the right.Marriott's Manor Club entrance is on the left. There will be small signs directing you to Marriott's Manor Club.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Carey Limousines 757-875-5466
  • Estimated taxi fare: 75 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: From I-64 West take Lightfoot Exit 234A (Rte. 199). Proceed on Rte. 199 East approximately 4.5 miles to Longhill Rd. Exit (Rte. 612). Stay in right exit lane and turn right at stoplight onto Longhill Rd. Proceed on Longhill Rd. for 2.4 miles to entrance to Ford's Colony on left. Turn left onto Ford's Colony Dr. and go 1.1 miles. Follow traffic circle to St. Andrews Dr that veers to the right.Marriott's Manor Club entrance is on the left. There will be small signs directing you to Marriott's Manor Club.

• Follow the signs to Interstate 66 East to Washington, D.C. Follow I-66 to the Theodore Roosevelt Bridge (US Route 50). Take the E Street exit off the bridge. Turn left onto 17th Street which becomes Connecticut Avenue. The hotel is on the right side of Connecticut Avenue.

Take 95 North for 49 miles to Exit 76 (Blue Heron Blvd) for 6.5 miles. Turn right off the exit and follow for approximately 4 miles. Continue over the Blue Heron Bridge and make a right at Lake Drive traffic light (2nd light). Turn left onto Tacoma Lane and follow to end. Turn right on Ocean Avenue. Marriott’s Ocean Pointe is the 1st driveway on the left. From Florida's Turnpike (North and Southbound): Take exit 109 to PGA Boulevard east, proceed 4.5 miles to US 1. Cross US 1, which becomes A1A, continue 5.1 miles to Lake Drive, turn left. Proceed 0.6 miles to the end of Lake Drive, bear left onto Inlet Way for 0.3 miles. Proceed to the end of Inlet Way, turn left. The main resort entrance is 0.2 miles ahead on the right.

Take US-395 South towards Carson City/South Lake Tahoe for approximately 30.6 miles to US-50. Continue on US-50 South approximately 22.3 miles to South Lake Tahoe. Estimated travel time 1 hour 15 minutes.

From Terminal Dr. head west following the signs for departure and toward I-595 W. Keep right at the fork, following the signs for I-595 W/95/Florida's Turnpike. Keep left to stay on I-95 S, following signs for Miami for 25.1 miles. Exit I-95 via ramp at sign reading I-395 E (MacArthur Causeway) to Miami Beach. Travel 1.4 miles and continue onto Florida A1A N/State A1A N. Travel 3.7 miles then exit LEFT on Collins Avenue. Continue on Collins Avenue for 0.8 mile then turn right onto 14th St. Turn left onto Ocean Dr. and the resort will be on the left.

Exit Kahului Airport and continue onto AIRPORT ACCESS RD. AIRPORT ACCESS RD becomes KUIHELANI HWY/HWY 380 at PUUNENE intersection. Continue straight onto KUIHELANI HWY/HWY 380 until last traffic signal. Turn LEFT onto HONOAPIILANI HWY/HWY 30 and continue north. Proceed toward Lahaina & Ka'anapali. Turn left at traffic light at KAANAPALI PARKWAY, proceed ¼ mile to NOHEA KAI DRIVE, turn left and Resort entrance will be on right.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate transportation: SpeediShuttle and Arthur’s Limousine; reservation required
  • Bus service fee: $50 USD (one way)
  • Estimated taxi fare: $90 USD (one way)

Airports.airportName: Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport - PHX
Airports.drivingDirection: Take Interstate 10 West to Highway 51 North to Loop 101 East to the Tatum Boulevard exit. Turn left and follow the boulevard to Marriott Drive. Turn right and at the roundabout take the first right into Canyon Villas.

From I-95 (Northbound): Take Exit 79A for PGA Boulevard east, proceed 2.6 miles to US 1. Cross US 1, which becomes A1A, continue 5.1 miles to Lake Drive, turn left. Proceed 0.6 miles to the end of Lake Drive, bear left onto Inlet Way for 0.3 miles. Proceed to the end of Inlet Way, turn left. The main resort entrance is 0.2 miles ahead on the right. From Florida's Turnpike (North and Southbound): Take exit 109 to PGA Boulevard east, proceed 4.5 miles to US 1. Cross US 1, which becomes A1A, continue 5.1 miles to Lake Drive, turn left. Proceed 0.6 miles to the end of Lake Drive, bear left onto Inlet Way for 0.3 miles. Proceed to the end of Inlet Way, turn left. The main resort entrance is 0.2 miles ahead on the right.

Airports.airportName: Salt Lake City International Airport - SLC
Airports.drivingDirection: Directions from Salt Lake City Airport: Take I-80 East to exit 145 toward Kimball Junction. Turn right at the end of the ramp onto UT-224 S and go 5.7 miles to the intersection where you see the sign for Main Street. Turn left onto Deer Valley Drive. Go through the first light (Bonanza Drive) and follow the road as it curves to the right. Marriott Summit Watch will be the 3rd (third) entrance on the right just past the entrance to Main Street. Turn into our roundabout to arrive at the lobby. We do have a Main street address, but our lobby is off of Deer Valley Drive.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Contact Concierge Services at 435-647-4100 for information on transportation
  • Estimated taxi fare: $85-165 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Exit airport on Terminal Access Road to US-1N to Hwy 21. Then take the New Jersey Turnpike /I-95 exit. Merge onto I-95 N and take exit 16E toward Lincoln Tunnel. Stay right at RT-495E. Turn Right at 40th St, then turn right at 5th Ave. Turn right at 37th St and the hotel will be on the right.

From Highway 101 South/San Francisco International Airport: Take Highway 101N to Interstate-80E (To Bay Bridge), exit 4th St., go straight one block to 3rd St. Turn left onto 3rd St. Cross Market St. 3rd St. becomes Kearny St. Take first right onto Post, turn right onto Montgomery, then turn right onto Market Street. The Ritz-Carlton Club and Residences is on the right.

Take 95 North to Exit 76 (Blue Heron Blvd) for 6.5 miles. Turn right off the exit and follow for approximately 4 miles. Continue over the Blue Heron Bridge and make a right at Lake Drive traffic light (2nd light). Turn left onto Tacoma Lane and follow to end. Turn right on Ocean Avenue. Marriott’s Ocean Pointe is the 1st driveway on the left. From Florida's Turnpike (North and Southbound): Take exit 109 to PGA Boulevard east, proceed 4.5 miles to US 1. Cross US 1, which becomes A1A, continue 5.1 miles to Lake Drive, turn left. Proceed 0.6 miles to the end of Lake Drive, bear left onto Inlet Way for 0.3 miles. Proceed to the end of Inlet Way, turn left. The main resort entrance is 0.2 miles ahead on the right.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Towncar
  • Estimated taxi fare: 35.00 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Take Airport road to Hwy 278. Turn East. Follow 278 approximately 9 miles to the Sea Pines Traffic Circle. Take 2nd right onto Greenwood Drive. Entrance fee to Sea Pines (per car): USD 6.00. Upon check-in at the resort, receive Sea Pines pass. Make right on Plantation Drive. At stop sign turn right onto Lighthouse Rd. Resort is 1 mile ahead on the right hand side. Lobby phone number: 843-363-3020.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Lowcountry Adventure Tours
  • Estimated taxi fare: 30 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Travel east on East Airport Drive to South Haven Avenue and turn left. Take the ramp for Interstate 10 East and merge onto the freeway. Continue on Interstate 10 East to the Monterey Avenue exit and turn right. Follow Monterey Avenue for 1.5 miles to Shadow Ridge Road and turn left.

From Fort Lauderdale/Hollywood International Airport: Take US 1 N, 1 mile to SE 17th St. Go east on 17th St. for approximately 2 miles, the road becomes Fort Lauderdale Beach Boulevard (formerly State Road A1A). Continue north on Fort Lauderdale Beach Boulevard approximately 1.5 miles. The resort is on the left behind BeachPlace Shopping Mall. Enter the parking garage from either Cortez Street or Fort Lauderdale Beach Boulevard northbound, take a ticket, and proceed to level P4 or P5. From Points North: Take I-95 South to Sunrise Boulevard Go east approximately 4.5 miles to Fort Lauderdale Beach Boulevard (formerly State Rd A1A). Go south on Fort Lauderdale Beach Boulevard for approximately 1 mile. The resort garage entrance is on left. Take a parking ticket and go to garage level P4 or P5 for the resort entrance.

SKB-St. Kitts (Robert L. Bradshaw Arpt.): Exit Airport, at roundabout, take 2nd exit. Go straight to end of road. Turn left onto Frigate Bay Road. At 1st roundabout keep right, continuing on Frigate Bay Road. At next roundabout, take 2nd exit at next roundabout, take 1st exit. Continue to hotel on right. The Marriott's St. Kitts Beach Club is on the same complex as the St. Kitts Marriott Resort & Casino.

Airports.airportName: Vail Eagle County Regional Airport - EGE
Airports.drivingDirection: Go NW on N. Airport Rd. to US-6. Turn left on US-6 . Merge on I-70 E toward Denver for 61.3 miles. Take exit #201 (Frisco/Breckenridge) & turn right on W. Main St. Turn right on S. Summit Blvd./CO Hwy 9 & continue for 9.3 miles. Continue through to last stoplight in Breckenridge (next to the Conoco Gas Station). At light take right on Broken Lance Dr. At stopsign take right & continue 1/8 mi. to our property located on right side. Parking is limited to one space per villa.
Airports.transportHelpInfo: • Contact our At Your Service Team at 970-453-8500 for information on transportation

Airports.drivingDirection: Exit Airport and proceed around traffic circle. Follow signs for Route 646 East (Mill Road). Stay on Mill Road East to Route 9 North. Turn left at light onto Route 9. Cross over Route 30 and continue on Route 9 North approximately 2.5 miles. Turn left into Marriott's Fairway Villas and proceed down Fairway Lane to the Registration Building located on the left.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Absolute Transportation
  • Estimated taxi fare: 30.00 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Exit airport, turn left on El Cielo. Go approx. 1/2 mile (6 /10ths) to Ramon Road. Turn left on Ramon Road, go 6 miles to I-10. Take I-10 East for 3 1/2 miles and exit at Cook Street. Turn right on Cook Street, go 2 1/2 miles to the Villas entrance. The entrance is on Cook Street, on right side of street 1/2 mile past Country Club Drive. Turn right on Riviera Drive.

Follow the signs to Playa De Palma / Santanyi / Llucmajor and take exit #20 at the sign Son Antem. At the round about take the 2nd exit to the right and follow this small lane for about 1 km, parallel to the hwy. At the large Marriott sign turn right until you come through the security gate of the resort and continue following the signs to the hotel where the reception is located.

Start going North toward East Plumb Lane -- 0.3 miTake the I-580N/US-395N ramp on the left to I-80/Reno/Sparks/Truckee -- 341 ftKeep right at the fork and merge onto I-580N/US-395N -- 2.7 miTake exit 68B to merge onto I-80W toward Sacremento entering California -- 32.0 miTake exit 188 for CA-89/CA-267 toward Sierraville/Lake Taho, at bottom of off ramp turn left onto CA-267S -- 6.2 miYou will hit Northstar Drive at a light and find signs to Northstar at Tahoe Go straight past and take your first right onto Highlands Drive*** (you will find a big sign that says Ritz-Carlton Highlands, Lake Tahoe and at the bottom, Northstar HighlandsFollow the road all the way up, you will find another sign for The Ritz-Carlton, turn left onto the road -- 2.9 miYou will find signs to The Ritz-Carlton Club, follow signs, stay to the right, go past the loading dock of the Hotel, up the winding road, the Club is at the top of the Highlands Gondola***If chain controls are in placeTurn RIGHT on Northstar Drive -- 0.2 miWhen you reach the ROUNDABOUT, proceed three-quarters of the way around the ROUNDABOUT and turn RIGHT on Ridgeline Drive -- 0.5 miWhen Ridgeline Drive dead ends, turn RIGHT on Highlands View Road and proceed as above.

From I-95 (Northbound): Take Exit 79A for PGA Boulevard east, proceed 2.6 miles to US 1. Cross US 1, which becomes A1A, continue 5.1 miles to Lake Drive, turn left. Proceed 0.6 miles to the end of Lake Drive, bear left onto Inlet Way for 0.3 miles. Proceed to the end of Inlet Way, turn left. The main resort entrance is 0.2 miles ahead on the right. From Florida's Turnpike (North and Southbound): Take exit 109 to PGA Boulevard east, proceed 4.5 miles to US 1. Cross US 1, which becomes A1A, continue 5.1 miles to Lake Drive, turn left. Proceed 0.6 miles to the end of Lake Drive, bear left onto Inlet Way for 0.3 miles. Proceed to the end of Inlet Way, turn left. The main resort entrance is 0.2 miles ahead on the right.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate transportation: Towncar
  • Estimated taxi fare: $35 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Take Airport road to Hwy 278. Turn East. Follow 278 approximately 9 miles to the Sea Pines Traffic Circle. Take 2nd right onto Greenwood Drive. At Sea Pines gate, pay $6 USD fee. Make right on plantation Dr. at stop sign, turn right onto Lighthouse Road. For Heritage Club - Turn left on Lighthouse Lane, 3/4 mile on right. Entrance fee to Sea Pines (per car): USD 6.00. Upon check-in at the resort, receive Sea Pines pass. 18 Lighthouse Lane Lobby phone number: 843-363-3012
Exit north to 528 West (Beach Line) (this is a toll road). Exit 3/John Young Pkwy South, turn left on John Young Pkwy. Make a right onto Whisper Lakes, make a left into resort.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Mears Taxi Company, 423-5566
  • Estimated taxi fare: 50 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Exit airport on Grand Central Parkway W. Take exit 4 to Brooklyn Queens Expressway toward 1-278. Merge onto E Brooklyn Queens Expy S/Queens Midtown Expy S. Take exit 35 and merge onto I-495 W. Take exit toward 3rd Ave/41. Merge onto E 37th St and the hotel will be on the right.

Turn right out of the airport on to Hwy. 82 towards Aspen. Travel approximately 2.2. miles to the traffic circle. At the traffic circle exit the first exit (Maroon Creek Road). Travel approximately 1.4 miles to the Highlands Ski area. Turn left on Prospector Road and drive straight into the Ritz-Carlton Club.

Take Interstate 95 North to exit 8. Follow Highway 278 across the Hilton Head Island bridge. Travel approximately four miles to the Cross Island Expressway and pay the USD 1.25 toll. Take the expressway onto Palmetto Bay Road and proceed one mile, moving into the right lane. Take the first right turn onto Greenwood Drive. At the Sea Pines gate pay the USD 6 fee and turn right onto Plantation Drive. Turn right at the stop sign onto Lighthouse Road. The hotel is one-half mile on the right. Lobby phone number 843-363-3020.

Travel east on World Way to the ramp for CA-1/Sepulveda Boulevard South toward Interstate 105. Merge onto South Sepulveda Boulevard and continue to East Imperial Highway. Turn left and take the ramp for Interstate 105 East. Merge onto Interstate 105 East and continue to the exit for Interstate 605 North/Interstate 605 South. Merge onto Interstate 605 North. Take the Interstate 10 West exit toward Los Angeles then merge onto Interstate 10 East. Follow Interstate 10 East to the Monterey Avenue exit and turn right. Travel on Monterey Avenue for 1.5 miles to Shadow Ridge Road and turn left.

Turn left onto El Cielo Road and proceed to Ramon Road. Turn left and continue on Ramon Road for six miles to Interstate 10 East. Take Interstate 10 East to the first exit and turn right onto Monterey Avenue. Follow Monterey Avenue for 1.5 miles to Shadow Ridge Road and turn left.

By car from CDG (44 km SE) Take A1/A3 Freeway direction Paris Est/Marne-la-Vallee, then Freeway A104 direction Marne-la-Vallee, then Freeway A4 direction Metz/Nancy - exit 14 direction Bailly-Romainvilliers Disneyland - first exit right to Bailly-Romainvilliers, at traffic light turn left, at round-about turn left direction Magny-le-Hongre. Resort is on your left at second traffic light. Transfer Service from/to Airport upon reservation at cost.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Transfer service or bus
  • Estimated taxi fare: 120.00 EUR (one way)
  • Subway service fee: 18 EUR (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Take H1- 93 West toward Waianae for 18 miles and exit right at Ko Olina. After passing the guard stand, drive one mile to Waipahe Place and turn right at Lagoon 4 Ulu’a.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: SpeediShuttle, reservation required 808-679-4804
  • Estimated taxi fare: 90.00 USD (one way)
  • Onsite Enterprise Rent-A-Car desk For additional transportation please contact concierge services at 808-679-4728

Airports.drivingDirection: From West:Take Atlantic City Expwy East to Exit 5 - Rte. 9. Go left after paying $0.50 toll (exact change only) onto Rte. 9 head North. Follow approx. 4 miles to Fairway Lane. Turn left on Fairway Lane into Marriott's Fairway Villas, follow signs to Registration. From North: Follow Garden State Parkway South to Exit 48. Proceed to Rte. 9 South & go 7.5 miles, make a right on Fairway Lane. Turn right on Fairway Lane into Marriott's Fairway Villas. Follow signs to Registration. From South: I-95 North over Delaware Memorial Bridge, follow signs for Atlantic City / Route 40 East. Follow Route 40 east to Route 575 N. Follow 575 N 5 miles & take right on Jimmie Leeds Road. Follow 6 miles to Route 9 S. Hotel on right.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Absolute Transportation
  • Estimated taxi fare: $140 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Take Exit 8 in South Carolina (Highway 278). Go East on Hwy 278 for approx. 20 miles. Go over two consecutive bridges that span the Inter Coastal waterway onto Hilton Head Island. As you reach the division of Hwy 278, stay in the right lane, following the signs for Hwy 278 business (William Hilton Parkway). Continue on William Hilton Pkwy, until the entrance to Port Royal Plantation which will be on your left. At traffic light, turn left and enter Port Royal Plantation. Turn left at 2nd road on left. Follow this road to the stop sign, turn right. Go through tunnel, turn right into the resort. If you are arriving after hours, press call button on keypad outside guardhouse to reach a resort associate to raise entrance gate.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Airport shuttle service, fee: 35.00 USD (one way)
  • Estimated taxi fare: 58.00 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: From I-95: Take exit 8 in South Carolina (Highway 278). Go East on Hwy 278 for approx. 20 miles. Go over two consecutive bridges that span the Inter Coastal waterway onto Hilton Head Island. As you reach the division of Hwy 278, stay in the right lane, following the signs for Hwy 278 business (William Hilton Parkway). Proceed approx. 6 miles to Shelter Cove Harbour, go past the plaza and the mall at Shelter Cove. At the traffic light, turn right, then take second quick left onto Shelter Cove Lane and continue 6/10 of a mile. The resort entrance is on the left.

Take I-70 West toward Vail/Grand Junction. Follow I-70 for 112 miles and take the Vail exit #176. Stay left in the roundabout and go back under I-70. At the second roundabout, turn right onto South Frontage Road. Follow South Frontage Road about 1 mile, then turn left onto West Lionshead Circle. The Ritz-Carlton Club, Vail, will be on your right at 728 West Lionshead Circle.
SR # 417 South to exit 6 (SR 536 West) towards 535 (tolls apply). Turn right on World Center.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Alternate Transportation: Mears Shuttle Service
  • Estimated taxi fare: 40 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: Take FL-417 S to Orlando (Portions toll). Take the SR-528-TOLL West Exit 26, toward International Airport. Take the John Young Pkwy/ SR-423 Exit 3. South on John Young. Make a right onto Whisper Lakes. Make a left into the resort.

Upon exiting Myrtle Bch Int'l Airport, go to 17 Bypass. Turn right on 17 Bypass towards North Myrtle Bch. Stay on 17 Bypass, turn right on 82nd Ave North (Parkway). Follow 82nd Ave North to next traffic light (Business 17/Kings Highway), go through traffic light for approx 1 mile. Make right on Grande Dunes Blvd.

From Interstate 95 take exit 8 and continue for approximately 30 minutes on Highway 278. After crossing the bridge onto Hilton Head Island, travel 4 miles to the Cross Island Expressway toll road. Follow the expressway onto Palmetto Bay Road. Travel one mile and move to the left lane. Take the second exit onto Pope Avenue and proceed to the second traffic light. Turn right onto Cordillo Parkway and continue to the end of the road. Turn right and pass through the Sea Pines rear gate. The entrance fee is USD 6 per car. Monarch villas will be one mile on the left.

From 93 North: Exit 23. Stay left after tunnel and follow signs to the Aquarium. At first traffic light turn left following signs for Aquarium. Take a right onto State Street. Hotel is 1st driveway on the left. From 93 South: Exit 24A (Government Street). Left at traffic light following signs for Aquarium. Right onto State Street. The hotel is the first driveway on the left.

Take US-580 South towards Carson City/South Lake Tahoe for approximately 30.6 miles to US-50. Continue on US-50 South approximately 22.3 miles to South Lake Tahoe. Estimated travel time 1 hour 15 minutes.
Airports.transportHelpInfo:
• Estimated taxi fare: $180 USD (one way)
  • Alternate Transportation: South Tahoe Airporter/Drop-off point is Lake Tahoe Resort Hotel next door, reservation required

Airports.drivingDirection: Exit the airport onto Ahukini Road, then take the first left turn onto Kapule Highway. Proceed to Rice Street and turn left. The resort entrance is approximately ¼ mile on the left. Continue up the driveway for approximately 1 mile crossing 2 bridges make a left at the second bridge and continue to Kalanipu’u.

From I-95 take exit 8, continue on Hwy 278 (approx. 30mins). Once over the HHI bridge, go approx. 4 miles to the Cross Island Expressway($1.25 toll road). Follow expressway onto Palmetto Bay Rd. Proceed 1 mile. Move to right lane, take first right onto Greenwood Dr. At Sea Pines gate, pay $5 usd per car fee. Make right onto Plantation DR. at stop sign, turn right onto Lighthouse Rd. For Harbour Club - 1 mile on right hand side. 144 Lighthouse Road Lobby phone number: 843-363-3020 For Heritage Club - Turn left on Lighthouse Lane, 3/4 mile on right. 12 Lighthouse Lane Lobby phone number: 843-363-3012

From airport turn left onto Beach City Rd. At intersection to William Hilton Parkway/Hwy 278, turn left on 278. Continue on William Hilton Pkwy past Port Royal Plantation. Just past the intersection at Mathews Drive/Folly Field Rd, take the third left onto Burkes Beach Rd. Take the first left onto Fifth Street, and the resort gatehouse will be located to the right. If arrive after hours, press call button on the keypad to reach a resort associate to raise the entrance gate. For GPS or Internet Mapping Systems, use destination address as follows: 10 Fifth Street, Hilton Head, SC 29928 as the resort address.
SR # 417 South to exit 6 (SR 536 West) towards 535 (tolls apply). Turn right on World Center Drive and turn right on Vacation Way.

  • Estimated taxi fare: 55 USD (one way)

Airports.drivingDirection: SR # 417 South to exit 6 (SR 536 West) towards 535 (tolls apply). Turn right on World Center Drive and turn right on Vacation Way.
